input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies the name of the filter list to which the filter is added. Each filter defines a set of inbound or outbound network traffic to be secured.
{ Me or Any or IPAddress or DNSName or ServerType} Specifies the source IP address, DNS name, or server type for the IP traffic. You can use WINS, DNS, DHCP, or gateway for ServerType.
{ Me or Any or IPAddress or DNSName or ServerType} Specifies the destination IP address, DNS name, or server type for the IP traffic. You can use WINS, DNS, DHCP, or gateway for ServerType.
Provides information about the IP filter.

{ ANY or ICMP or TCP or UDP or RAW or Integer } Specifies the IP protocol if, in addition to addressing information, you want to filter a specific IP protocol. The default value is ANY, meaning all protocols are used for the filter.

{ yes or no} Specifies whether to create a mirrored filter. Use yes to create two filters based on the filter settings--one for traffic to the destination and one for traffic from the destination. The default value is yes.

{ Mask or Prefix} Specifies the source address subnet mask or the prefix of the packets to be filtered. You can specify a prefix value in the range of 1 through 32. The default value is the mask of 255.255.255.255.

{ Mask or Prefix} Specifies the destination address subnet mask or the prefix value of the packets to be filtered. You can specify a prefix value in the range of 1 through 32. The default value is the mask of 255.255.255.255.

Specifies the source port number of the packets to be filtered. This option only applies if you are filtering TCP or UDP packets. If 0 is specified, packets sent from any port are filtered. The default is any.

Specifies the destination port number of the packets to be filtered. This option only applies if you are filtering TCP or UDP packets. If 0 is specified, packets sent to any port are filtered. The default is any.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:param name="mirrored"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${mirrored}</xsl:text> </xsl:param> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh ipsec static add filter filterlist=${filter list} srcaddr=${srcaddr} dstaddr=${destaddr} description=$[description]</xsl:text> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${protocol}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> protocol=any</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> protocol=${protocol}</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="$mirrored ='yes' or $mirrored='no'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> mirror=${mirrored}</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> mirrored=yes</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:if test="string-length('${srcmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> srcmask=${srcmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${destmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> dstmask=${destmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${srcport}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> srcport=${srcport}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${destport}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> dstport=${destport}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Adds a filter to the specified filter list.
